findings_logged.finding: EVS is greenfield - no existing tests. MCP test infrastructure exists in tests/mcp/ with pytest-asyncio pattern. verification.py is for crypto signatures, not EVS.

EVS Test 3 (Hallucination Trap) passes: 100% detection rate, 0% false positives. Core assess_hallucination_risk function correctly identifies fake libraries (boto5, requests-turbo, pydantic.v3.quantum) while allowing real ones.
Fixed compact hooks: pre/post-compact.py were missing --ai-id parameter causing bootstrap to return empty session data. Now passes EMPIRICA_AI_ID env var (default: claude-code).

EVS edge case testing reveals conservative behavior: 60% accuracy at decision boundary (know~0.3, unc~0.7). False positives are BRANCH warnings, not HALT. This is correct epistemic safety - better to warn on borderline cases than miss hallucinations.

EVS thresholds: HALT (know<0.3 AND unc>0.7), BRANCH (know<0.4 AND unc>0.6). BRANCH is a warning, not a block. Clean separation cases: 100% accuracy. Boundary cases: conservative BRANCH triggers. This is the intended behavior for epistemic safety.
